citation.article-title: Sediminitomix flava gen. nov., sp. nov., of the phylum Bacteroidetes, isolated from marine sediment
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Sediminitomix (Se.di.mi.ni.to′mix. L. n. sedimen -inis sediment; L. fem. n. tomix a thread; N.L. fem. n. Sediminitomix a thread isolated from sediment).
Gram-negative, non-motile, long rods (10–35 μm long and 0.5–0.7 μm in width), chemo-organotrophic, catalase- and oxidase-positive.
Major cellular fatty acids are iso-C15 : 0, C16 : 1ω5c and C16 : 0 3-OH.
The main respiratory quinone is MK-7.
Growth occurs at 15–40 °C, negative result in the O/F test for glucose.
The DNA G+C content is 38 mol%.
The type species of the genus is Sediminitomix flava.
